data.title: Louise of Orleans, Queen Consort of Charles II of Spain (1662
data.meta_description: Marie-Louise dOrleans (1662-1689) was the eldest daughter of Philippe, Duke of Orleans (1640-1701), younger brother of Louis XIV of France, andÂ the Dukes first wife, Henrietta Anne of England (1644-1670), the youngest daughter of King Charles I and sister of Charles II. Her marriage to Carlos II of Spain (1661-1700) was seen as a way to induce better relations between France and Spain following conflict between the two nations over the disputed territory of the Spanish Netherlands.The proxy marriage...
